list_ex_of_english: In normal circumstances one finds that the more work people have to do, the more grumpy and less courteous they are.
I think of the words that are bandied about in television programmes, such as "grumpy old", "boring old", "silly old"and"dirty old".
This is not the grumpy memoir that one comes to expect from old colonial officers.
They seem to have different personalities, one is dramatic and stuffy, the other is grumpy and cynical.
I do not believe that they are merely grumpy anecdotes of the dissatisfied.
It may be part of the grumpy old man syndrome, but the environment around me is changing, and not for the better.
What is the position when the disabled person is having an extremely good day but has to meet with a very grumpy and bad assessor?
Grumpy little motifs keep welling up, or trying to.
